column4: does anyone know why my shell script isn't working? it just says no such file or directory -.-
'which [script name]' ought to show the path to the script
Pici: /usr/local/bin/srcds_checker
will bash handle your script correctly?
i have no idea, i'm a bit beginner :/
try bash [path-to-script]
that does work, but gives errors
did you make any progress with that script?
i'm trying to debug... it's something in the script breaking it
that strace dump looked like it couldn't find the file srcds_checker..
it is there, i can run it with sh ./srcds_checker ... but i get errors
what errors do you mean?
here: http://paste.ubuntu.com/235244/
and the script is here: http://paste.ubuntu.com/235245/
I think if [ -n "$pid" ] would probably be more efficient than what you are using
it will save you some else/elseif/fi headaches
i will test it, wait :P
hehe did you receive my last messages?
irc crashed, i got "it will save you headaches", and after that "did you receive"
you missed nothing then
